ExpressJS Overview

Express.js is a Javascript framework based on Node.js, that supports development both on the server side and the user side. Express is a very fast, essential, assertive, and moderate web framework of

# 

<span key="c466aa681ff54d829fc537939d20c1ef"><span offset-key="c466aa681ff54d829fc537939d20c1ef:0">ExpressJS Overview</span></span>

<span key="f322b40d2c13494a80d693bf12bc2e84">**Topics Covered**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="0e1afbdbb34b475ba378f9b3d697cd8e"><span offset-key="0e1afbdbb34b475ba378f9b3d697cd8e:0">Feature of Express</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d1eba236c7f74bf88186dfef2594492b"><span offset-key="d1eba236c7f74bf88186dfef2594492b:0">How does Express work?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="6dda277c388443378a882931a2206492"><span offset-key="6dda277c388443378a882931a2206492:0">Why Express?</span></span>

### 

<span key="3ff1b4b955cf4b5ba3713fcb2f16bc62">**Features of Express Framework:**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="626d048832a64d97857476dc65a71381"><span offset-key="626d048832a64d97857476dc65a71381:0">Express can be used to design a single-page, multi-page and hybrid web applications.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ef3c6553f9014c04950706248894a2b4"><span offset-key="ef3c6553f9014c04950706248894a2b4:0">Express allows to setup middlewares to respond to HTTP Requests.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="737fdb278c354bf592c5df74df960c7d"><span offset-key="737fdb278c354bf592c5df74df960c7d:0">Express defines a routing table which is used to performs different actions based on HTTP method and URL.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ea737c0ef9714874bd20683f3114f098"><span offset-key="ea737c0ef9714874bd20683f3114f098:0">Express allows to dynamically render HTML Pages based on passing arguments to templates.</span></span>

### 

<span key="be2fad82e97049fab0af233ce7b78b9c">**How does Express work?**</span>

<span key="e5d46e4c5c13481c877b884306b5748f"><span offset-key="e5d46e4c5c13481c877b884306b5748f:0">Express applications work by sending a sequence of calls to the middle tier. The middleware has of two-course access to request objects and response objects. It means that using the Express framework gives you control over all request and response objects. This gives you the power to add the sessions, add the post parameters, and template through ejs.</span></span>

### 

<span key="7de42a9a33754e5f999b44964257d627">**Why Express?**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="77f8c4f28665456e92d2ba522b5f0010"><span offset-key="77f8c4f28665456e92d2ba522b5f0010:0">Ultrafast Input/Output.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="cd0282e479bc4b3a8e830ca7b77b699a"><span offset-key="cd0282e479bc4b3a8e830ca7b77b699a:0">Asynchronous and single threaded.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="d8551f82df334863bc32471fc8e4fff2"><span offset-key="d8551f82df334863bc32471fc8e4fff2:0">MVC like structure.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="06dbce4705054733bc73c5ac83af58f4"><span offset-key="06dbce4705054733bc73c5ac83af58f4:0">Robust API makes routing very easy.</span></span>

<span key="31c3a9cfabf94eb2b59b006d86bee090">**How does Express look like :**</span>

<span key="b0a7c7566a7d49648bc327291f93b5ce"><span offset-key="b0a7c7566a7d49648bc327291f93b5ce:0">Let’s see a basic express.js Example-</span></span>

# 

<span key="ba5190079adc4f2c980beb98bf31fdb4"><span offset-key="ba5190079adc4f2c980beb98bf31fdb4:0">ExpressJS Restful APIs</span></span>

<span key="9f4b86de59a245d0a06fddc605ed0fd0"><span offset-key="9f4b86de59a245d0a06fddc605ed0fd0:0">ExpressJS RESTful API is an application program interface (API) that uses HTTP requests to GET, PUT, POST and DELETE data.</span></span>

<span key="815d7062248446309624d54b971df05b">**Topics Covered**</span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="0e63db334b7c4fd783b1a0f8eba526ca"><span offset-key="0e63db334b7c4fd783b1a0f8eba526ca:0">What is ExpressJS Restful API?</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="06d2bff6a9ac4b90a76ab248d7440c27"><span offset-key="06d2bff6a9ac4b90a76ab248d7440c27:0">Why we need ExpressJS Restful APIs.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="4c0900db3a2c46edbed510c809632ac1"><span offset-key="4c0900db3a2c46edbed510c809632ac1:0">Advantages</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7ac069d3d42e47faa72b5d0745036a35"><span offset-key="7ac069d3d42e47faa72b5d0745036a35:0">Initialize npm and install the modules</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6d3886a0fa57486b973e4711e1c5244b"><span offset-key="6d3886a0fa57486b973e4711e1c5244b:0">Creates a New User</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6aea1b44041d472085ba8cbee8850745"><span offset-key="6aea1b44041d472085ba8cbee8850745:0">Returns All the Users From the Database</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="fd8d2281e48540fab148a0a7d255a6e5"><span offset-key="fd8d2281e48540fab148a0a7d255a6e5:0">Gets a Single User From the Database</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c7696d5da3254b2eaf511128e017af13"><span offset-key="c7696d5da3254b2eaf511128e017af13:0">Deletes a User From the Database</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1149493ebbcd4eb4b948f3efb1081c29"><span offset-key="1149493ebbcd4eb4b948f3efb1081c29:0">Updates a Single User in the Database</span></span>

<span key="48f4dcfae6114f669a7c8f7b11f17cfc">**Why we need ExpressJS Restful APIs**</span>

<span key="dc9e547937944876b1e235240f4b2f9f"><span offset-key="dc9e547937944876b1e235240f4b2f9f:0">The World Wide Web itself is based on HTTP and is based on RESTful API architecture. Mostly all the modern web browsers are RESTful API client. RESTful API applications use HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE) to perform CRUD operations.</span></span>

### 

<span key="3cd7894765b548e7875f6b55ac6edf7a"><span offset-key="3cd7894765b548e7875f6b55ac6edf7a:0">Advantages</span></span>

<span key="3bb4062a97fd440ebd55de74eb8294e8"><span offset-key="3bb4062a97fd440ebd55de74eb8294e8:0">1. Quick & easy development 2. High performance 3. Run on single thread to handle multiple concurrent requests 4. Easy to write APIs and interaction code 5. Streaming support 6. Monitoring possibilities 7. Authentication support 8. Lightweight, fast and scalable</span></span>

<span key="26187f7747c24552a28f18c53e1a5554"><span offset-key="26187f7747c24552a28f18c53e1a5554:0">Here is the restful API Design with Node</span></span>

<span key="201bcbf36b5d413bb736b8a225733f31">**Initialize npm and install the following modules:**</span>

1

<span key="57b936bd44c84745a4bb853a94503701"><span offset-key="57b936bd44c84745a4bb853a94503701:0">npm init</span></span>

<span key="533e4ca1877c485a821453542b902150"><span offset-key="533e4ca1877c485a821453542b902150:0">npm install express --save</span></span>

3

<span key="9205e4a27f784cf88f8c4743da17f25c"><span offset-key="9205e4a27f784cf88f8c4743da17f25c:0">npm install mongoose --save</span></span>

4

<span key="35cb64b04fc04efd8ff8c4157c1a859a"><span offset-key="35cb64b04fc04efd8ff8c4157c1a859a:0">npm install body-parser --saveCopy</span></span>

<span key="1b691942855347428afd4de6f11b0e55"><span offset-key="1b691942855347428afd4de6f11b0e55:0">Now, we will use ExpressJS for developing an application. It is a node.js framework. We will use Mongoose. Mongoose is an ORM (Object Relational Mapper). We use an ORM to simplify the transfer of data between our application and the database. The body-parser module is a middleware we are going to use, to parse our data sent through HTTP requests.</span></span>

<span key="55f45c1da02547e0ae901cc387f6e7d9"><span offset-key="55f45c1da02547e0ae901cc387f6e7d9:0">To start developing the application, create a file and name it as </span>*app.js*<span offset-key="55f45c1da02547e0ae901cc387f6e7d9:2">. <span key="2cabed8f0d914509a80a3352d0c8e81a"><span offset-key="2cabed8f0d914509a80a3352d0c8e81a:0">We will use a </span>*module.exports*<span offset-key="2cabed8f0d914509a80a3352d0c8e81a:2"> module to make the application’s object visible to the program when we call it using\* require()\*. <span key="dec54a477693478283238ccf504796f9"><span offset-key="dec54a477693478283238ccf504796f9:0">We have now added another GET request, the router.get method’s first parameter. <span key="32b3a4b93eb04d6b82ca8654d9a3264f"><span offset-key="32b3a4b93eb04d6b82ca8654d9a3264f:0">Mongoose has a method called .findById which is will use ID by which it will return a user information. The ID is the first parameter and the callback function is the second parameter. All the Mongoose methods want a value as a first parameter and a callback function as the last parameter. This callback will be called after the database has returned the query value. The same can be done with the DELETE request as well.</span></span>

# 

<span key="09ad98fc79c440bf8ed9e45446ecee0d"><span offset-key="09ad98fc79c440bf8ed9e45446ecee0d:0">ExpressJS Scaffolding</span></span>

<span key="6eb817722a344b16a7c60cd4a4e060ff"><span offset-key="6eb817722a344b16a7c60cd4a4e060ff:0">It is important to create RESTful API while working with ExpressJS. If you will create API you will have to go through a number of operations for the client request to be done. For any particular task, we use so many files like HTML, CSS, JAVASCRIPT, IMAGES and so on. To manage these files in directories and to create a proper structure we use </span>*Scaffolding*<span offset-key="6eb817722a344b16a7c60cd4a4e060ff:2">.</span></span>

<span key="e2147ee2721b456a817594ebd6f20e14"><span offset-key="e2147ee2721b456a817594ebd6f20e14:0">Scaffolding allows us to create a skeleton for a web application when we work with ExpressJS. We manually create our public directory, add middleware, create separate route files, etc. A scaffolding tool sets up all these things for us so that we can directly get started with building our application. For this, we have a number of modules like Yeoman and Express-generator.</span></span>

<span key="00063c6d342248c093258aa1621af8ec"><span offset-key="00063c6d342248c093258aa1621af8ec:0">We are going to start Scaffolding using the </span>*Express-generator*<span offset-key="00063c6d342248c093258aa1621af8ec:2"> module. For this, we have to install express-generator module.</span></span>

<span key="2e850313373e49db84a7dc0978fd1fa5"><span offset-key="2e850313373e49db84a7dc0978fd1fa5:0">Firstly, you need to open the folder in your editor where you want to work. I have opened ‘example’ folder in Visual Studio Code because I want to work here, Then open the terminal and install the Express-generator module. For this installation run the following command : –</span></span>

1

<span key="5f696152738c407cac729a48fee0d85b"><span offset-key="5f696152738c407cac729a48fee0d85b:0">C:\\node\\example>npm install express-generator -gCopy</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="f6ebb9f5ac134bb18fe24f5e3c0ac3ea"><span offset-key="f6ebb9f5ac134bb18fe24f5e3c0ac3ea:0">If you are planning to use it multiple times run the following command and install the express-generator globally like I did here. The command will take a few seconds. As soon as the express-generator will installed, now you need to run the express command like this and hit enter:-</span></span>

1

<span key="d20371692bf94e88a356295ad17d1efe"><span offset-key="d20371692bf94e88a356295ad17d1efe:0">C:\\node\\example>expressCopy</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="58959a9c04274fd4be3af9392d6a8ba0"><span offset-key="58959a9c04274fd4be3af9392d6a8ba0:0">So now you can find all the necessary directories and files has been created in your folder.\\</span></span>

<span key="0e85d65f188d449384c31359a7182de7"><span offset-key="0e85d65f188d449384c31359a7182de7:0">Every folder has different content inside.\\</span></span>

<span key="0c3ae9be6e9641c7911b3d83dc3e35d0"><span offset-key="0c3ae9be6e9641c7911b3d83dc3e35d0:0">Scaffolding</span></span>

<span key="571ab4c2beec4b3f8bdd0592cc681869"><span offset-key="571ab4c2beec4b3f8bdd0592cc681869:0">At first, you find a bin folder. There is only one file named ‘www’ inside this folder. This file actually contains the JavaScript which is necessary to start your server. It handles the port at which the server is running and it creates a server for your app.</span></span>

<span key="3f10af9610244c0586c9e1f60be6ec8f"><span offset-key="3f10af9610244c0586c9e1f60be6ec8f:0">In the public folder, you will have three folders they are images, javascripts, and stylesheets. Whichever file you want as a public thing you define them all here.You can put all the images, javascript here which you are going to use throughout your application.</span></span>

<span key="1c1b6b24a4624f4498f528f490900a93"><span offset-key="1c1b6b24a4624f4498f528f490900a93:0">‘Routes’ folder will help you to provide routing things. For example, as we know that we find different kinds of GET request in our application so here we can manage them in a single or different js file.</span></span>

<span key="5feb2647a7294841a9b906a2b5adac63"><span offset-key="5feb2647a7294841a9b906a2b5adac63:0">In the ‘view’ folder you put all your web pages.There are some files with the jade extension in view folder, JADE is a substitution for the HTML file where we don’t need to use tags. This makes our page more compact. The tag in HTML used as a key in JADE. If you are not familiar with jade you can continue with HTML or EJS.</span></span>

<span key="883d26624abb4bc0b4157a277681ca17"><span offset-key="883d26624abb4bc0b4157a277681ca17:0">You can see the file ‘app.js’ this is the main file for this application.Here you can see some module are used. All these modules are necessary for a basic app or we can use them according to our need. You will find some middleware also. Middlewares are an intermediate process which will be executed before the actual request got processed. There is some handler for developer environment and production environment.</span></span>

# 

<span key="f33813f11f9a4c32859b4ff994bacf0a"><span offset-key="f33813f11f9a4c32859b4ff994bacf0a:0">ExpressJS Static : Serving Static Files</span></span>

<span key="1ed4094ba35c457b94bca58384523f68"><span offset-key="1ed4094ba35c457b94bca58384523f68:0">Server static files using Express.js, we have created a directory with the name of public and express will automatically server all the files in the folder. We are going to server static file using app.use(express.static(‘public’)). This is know as middleware in express.</span></span>

<span key="017911d9f7864931bb5dace6b00c3dff"><span offset-key="017911d9f7864931bb5dace6b00c3dff:0">When we call root directory then express static middlerware automatically called public folder and it server index.html file from it.</span></span>

<span key="052e7abd28904fa2b6f7e051ed6fdc3b"><span offset-key="052e7abd28904fa2b6f7e051ed6fdc3b:0">serverstatic.js</span></span>
